alert.note: Alert for Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 6:52PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Martin County through 715 PM EDT... At 652 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Shoals, or 23 miles east of Petersburg, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Martin County, including the following locations... Lacy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for southwestern Indiana.
